creditline: Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr.
inscribed:
Inscribed in plate, lower left corner: brueghel • Inuentor • / H • Cock • excu • cu • priui

Initialed in plate, lower left: P / • AVE • 

Titled in plate, lower center: LVXVRIA •

One line of Latin and one line of Flemish inscribed in plate below image, lower center: LXVXRIA ENERVAT VIRES, EFFOEMINAT ARTVS. … Sy breeckt die Crachten en sy Swackt die leden

caption: Peter van der Heyden (ca. 1530–after 1572; born Antwerp, Belgium; died Berchem, Belgium), after Pieter Bruegel the Elder (ca. 1525–1569; born Breda, Netherlands; died Brussels, Belgium), Published by Hieronymus Cock (1507–1570; born and died  Antwerp, Belgium), Luxuria (Unchastity), 1558. Engraving; 22.7 x 29.7 cm (plate), 23 x 30.5 cm (sheet). Gift of Frank Jewett Mather Jr. (x1946-71)
